metadata.description: Top 10 Critical NDA Criteria - Universal standards for 95% of NDAs worldwide

universal_nda_criteria.description: Confidential Information must be clearly defined with scope, inclusions, and explicit exclusions (public info, prior knowledge, independent development)
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Clear definition with exclusions clause (public domain, rightfully possessed, independently developed)
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Vague definitions like 'any information' without exclusions, or overly broad scope

universal_nda_criteria.description: Information can only be used for the specified purpose stated in the NDA, not for any other purpose
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Explicit 'Purpose' clause limiting use to stated business objective
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: No purpose stated, or purpose too vague like 'any business purpose'

universal_nda_criteria.description: Receiving party must not disclose confidential information to third parties except authorized personnel on need-to-know basis
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Clear prohibition on disclosure plus need-to-know exception for employees/advisors bound by confidentiality
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Allows disclosure to 'affiliates' or 'partners' without binding them to confidentiality

universal_nda_criteria.description: Duration of confidentiality obligation must be specified (typically 2-5 years for commercial NDAs, perpetual for trade secrets)
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Specific time period like '3 years from disclosure date' or '5 years after agreement termination'
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Perpetual confidentiality for non-trade-secret info, or undefined duration

universal_nda_criteria.description: Upon termination or request, receiving party must return or certify destruction of all confidential materials
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Obligation to return or destroy within specific timeframe plus written certification requirement
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: No return or destruction clause, or allows retention of copies indefinitely

universal_nda_criteria.description: NDA does not obligate either party to disclose information or enter into further agreements
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Explicit 'no obligation' clause stating parties are free to not share info or transact
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Implies or requires disclosure of certain information or commits to future deals

universal_nda_criteria.description: Disclosure of confidential information does not grant license, transfer ownership, or convey any IP rights
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: 'No license' clause explicitly stating IP remains with disclosing party
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Implies license grant, joint IP ownership, or ambiguous IP rights language

universal_nda_criteria.description: Breach may cause irreparable harm and disclosing party has right to seek injunctive relief without proving damages
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Acknowledgment of irreparable harm plus right to injunctive or equitable relief in addition to damages
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Limits remedies to damages only, or requires proof of harm before injunction

universal_nda_criteria.description: Governing law and dispute resolution forum (court jurisdiction or arbitration) must be clearly specified
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Specific governing law and exclusive jurisdiction clause
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Foreign jurisdiction disadvantageous to you, or vague jurisdiction like 'mutually agreed'

universal_nda_criteria.description: Clear identification whether NDA is mutual (both parties share info) or unilateral (only one party discloses), with corresponding obligations
universal_nda_criteria.check_for: Explicit statement of mutual or unilateral nature with matching confidentiality obligations
universal_nda_criteria.red_flag: Ambiguous party obligations or one-sided obligations in supposedly mutual NDA
